author: victorgoransson
post_text: March 1, 2016 at 6:40 PM#1Hi!I am looking for a way to turn on and off "cmd disable" in an executor with a macro.Sometimes i want to use the cmd in my sequence and sometimes i dont..If theres a macro that can turn the "cmd disable" button on and off, i would be happy!Anyone got an ideas?

posts.author: victorgoransson
posts.post_text: March 1, 2016 at 6:40 PM#1Hi!I am looking for a way to turn on and off "cmd disable" in an executor with a macro.Sometimes i want to use the cmd in my sequence and sometimes i dont..If theres a macro that can turn the "cmd disable" button on and off, i would be happy!Anyone got an ideas?

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: March 1, 2016 at 7:36 PM#2Assign Exec x /cmddisable=("on or off")

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: March 2, 2016 at 9:38 PM#3HiWrite "list exec" in your command line, you'll get all options and their commands and syntaxes

posts.author: victorgoransson
posts.post_text: March 3, 2016 at 11:10 AM#4Thanks guys!Worked like a charm!

title: Macro for cmd disable
